meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to one-third of an inch, used in the UK and US.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter measured the table using barleycorns.
meanings.sent2: She estimated the length of the room to be about six barleycorns.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse thought the barleycorns were perfect for building a miniature house.
meanings.sent4: In the land of elves, the barleycorns were used as magical measuring sticks.
meanings.sent5: The children used barleycorns to mark the starting line of their race.

meanings.sent1: The farmer harvested a basket full of barleycorns from the field.
meanings.sent2: The chef used barleycorns to make a delicious barley soup.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole the barleycorns from the barn to hide them in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The golden barleycorns shimmered in the sunlight like tiny jewels.
meanings.sent5: The ancient recipe called for barleycorns to be soaked overnight before cooking.
